hero.alt: Lit beeswax candle in dark setting

instructions_to_main_agent.general: You are building a high-end, dark-mode e-commerce site. The vibe is 'Midnight Luxury'. Avoid standard white backgrounds. Every page should feel like a dimly lit art gallery.
setup: Configure Tailwind to use the custom colors defined in this JSON.
Use 'Playfair Display' from Google Fonts for all headings.
Use 'Montserrat' from Google Fonts for all body text.

components.navbar: Sticky, dark glassmorphism. Logo in Gold. Links in white uppercase tracking-widest.
components.hero: Full screen height. Dark image background with overlay. Centered serif typography. Gold CTA.
components.product_card: Minimalist. No border. Image aspect ratio 4:5. Title and price appear below. On hover, image zooms slightly.
components.footer: Massive padding (py-24). Dark background. Gold accents. Large typography for links.

pages.home: Hero -> Featured Collection (Carousel) -> About Snippet (Text + Image) -> Categories (Grid) -> Newsletter.
pages.shop: Sidebar filter (hidden on mobile) + Grid of products.
pages.product_detail: Split screen. Left: Image gallery (sticky). Right: Details, Add to Cart, Reviews.
pages.cart: Slide-over drawer or dedicated minimal page.

UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
